clinical_study.brief_title: Triple Therapy in Real-life: Impact on Adherence and Health Status (TRITRIAL)
clinical_study.official_title: The Impact on the Health Status and Adherence in a Real-life Setting of Italian Patients With Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease in Treatment With Trimbow® pMDI b.i.d.: a 12-month Prospective Observational Study

brief_summary.textblock: The mean objectives are to evaluate the impact of BDP/FF/G fixed combination on health-status and adherence

primary_outcome.measure: Change in COPD Assessment Test (CAT) score
primary_outcome.description: CAT consists of 8 items scored on a scale of 1 to 5, with a total score range of 0-40. A higher score denotes a more severe impact of COPD on the patient's life.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in COPD Assessment Test (CAT) score
secondary_outcome.description: CAT consists of 8 items scored on a scale of 1 to 5, with a total score range of 0-40. A higher score denotes a more severe impact of COPD on the patient's life.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in 12-item Test of Adherence to Inhalers (TAI-12) score
secondary_outcome.description: TAI comprises a patient domain (including 10 items) and a healthcare professional domain (including 2 items). Each item ranges from 1 (lowest adherence) to 5 (highest adherence) points. The patient domain score ranges from 10 to 50. Adherence is rated as good (score =50), intermediate (score = 46-49), or poor (score ≤45). The questions for healthcare professionals are scored with 1 or 2 points (poor or good knowledge of the regimen and/or inhalation technique).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in COPD and Asthma Sleep Impact Scale (CASIS) score
secondary_outcome.description: It is a self-administered 7-item scale scored on a five-point scale ranging from 0 if the item never applies, to 4 if the item applies very often. A total raw score is produced from the sum of the seven individual scores which is then linearly transformed to a 0-100 total scale score. Higher scores representing greater sleep deterioration in the previous week.

Il consists of 2 pages, a descriptive system and a visual Analogue scale. The descriptive system comprises 5 dimensions (mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, anxiety/depression), each dimension having 5 levels: no problems, slight problems, moderate problems, severe problems, and extreme problems. This decision results in a 1-digit number expressing the level selected for that dimension. The digits for 5 dimensions can be combined in a 5-digit number describing the respondent's health state.The VAS records the respondent's self-rated health on a 10 cm vertical VAS with endpoints labelled 'the best health you can imagine' and 'the worst health you can imagine'.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of an 8-item questionnaire on satisfaction and usability of the device score from baseline (Visit 1)
secondary_outcome.description: it contains 8 questions, each scored on a 0-5 Likert scale, which range from 0 (fully disagree) to 5 (fully agree), for a total maximum score of 40. Higher scores indicate a higher ease of use and satisfaction with the inhaler
